alert.note: Alert for Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 10:44AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Nelson and central Washington Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1044 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bardstown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Washington and northeastern Nelson Counties, including the following locations... East Bardstown, Booker, Maud, Botland, Mooresville, Polin, Croakes, Pulliam, Willisburg and Fredericktown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon EDT for central Kentucky. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
